alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 26 at 5:04AM EDT until March 27 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, with local amounts to 6 inches at elevations above 3500 ft. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph at times. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...Through 2 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Untreated roads, especially at higher elevations, will become snow covered and hazardous. Gusty winds and snow, that is initially wet and heavy, could lead to some tree damage and isolated power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures tonight are expected to dip into the teens. Wind chills are expected to be near zero.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Use extra caution while driving. Please report snow accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov, by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4, or through our "submit a storm report" option on our web page. Regardless of the method used to provide the report, please include with your observation the specific location where it occurred as well as the time. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
